timeline.message: [SCRIPTS ONLY] possible to use JDK6 to run tests
Using maven 3.2.5 as the last version working on JDK6
[RELEASE SCRIPT ONLY] 4.17 branch works with tags only not with the binary releases

timeline.bodyText: Why do we only run the tests on JDK 1.6?
timeline.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: It's the test for not being run on JDK 1.6 as there is the trouble as test checks for suppressed exceptions. Skipping these few tests on 1.6 was the shortcut to proceed with testing on JDK6.
replies.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Will we run these tests for JDK7+ still?
replies.author: tomjenkinson

replies.bodyText: Is that because we aren't allowed to do introspection to see if suppressed exceptions are available (I think that is what the later code did)? And is there no check for 1.5 because we don't support 1.5?
replies.author: mmusgrov
ochaloup

replies.bodyText:
I meant why aren't we using refection to see if the method exists like we do in the main code (
https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/4.17.43.Final/ArjunaJTA/jta/classes/com/arjuna/ats/internal/jta/transaction/arjunacore/TransactionImple.java#L1684) rather than checking for specific JDK versions.
replies.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: By my opinion we can use both approaches here. The reflection targets the difference more precisely as we do use from JDK API only this method.
replies.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: And the reason why I chose to use the check for the java version is that it sounds me more reasonable for the test approach.
replies.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: I will use the similar approach as for TransactionImple to be done in the same way
replies.author: ochaloup

timeline.bodyText: What was the problem with Utils.removeRecursive? Is it using features that aren't in 1.6?
timeline.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText: So do you mean that the code inside FileUtils.deleteRecursive() is using features that are not available 1.6
replies.author: mmusgrov

replies.bodyText:
Sorry, I probably explained wrongly.
The FileUtils uses the code which is available in 1.6. That's the reason why I took that class it into the changeset.
The Utils class uses the file nio utils methods which are not available on JDK6. That's the reason for replacing it.
replies.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Ah right, got you thanks. I'll mark this conversation as resolved then.
replies.author: mmusgrov

timeline.message:
[JDK6 compatibility] test changes to fix JDK6 compatibility

* Throwable#getSuppressed is available from JDK7
* do not using java nio methods from JDK7
* fix dependencies to be compatible with JDK6 (H2 and maven enforcer plugin)
* skip tests which does not work on JDK6 because of InitialContext rebind
* not executing 'narayana-full' on tests as assembly was already created
  during build and it fails with JDK6
